snippet: Adopting a technique from clothing manufacture, the automaker is using post-consumer plastic bottles in the seat covers for the Focus Electric.
abstract: Adopting a technique from clothing manufacture, the automaker is using post-consumer plastic bottles in the seat covers for the Focus Electric.
lead_paragraph: According to Shopautoweek.com, an automotive information site and shopping portal, more than 70,000 bottles of soft drinks will be consumed and discarded during the Detroit auto show this month. But one man's trash is apparently another's seat cover for a $40,000 hatchback.

headline.main: Ford Is Covering Seats in Soda Bottles
